title: Michael Jordan selling: NBA legend looking to score a buyer for his $10.91 million Park City house
text:
If you truly want to “Be Like Mike,” you can buy his house. NBA legend Michael Jordan has placed his mountain retreat on the market for $AU 10.92 million ($US 7.5 million).

While that’s a lot of money to pay for a vacation home, it’s actually less than MJ shelled out 12 years ago.

RELATED: Dwyane Wade selling extravagant Miami Beach home

Shaq relists his huge Florida mansion

Obama splashes $22 million on island estate

The all-time greatest basketballer purchased the Park City property in 2007 for $US 7.9 million, according to Mansion Global.

Built in 2006, the five-bedroom and 7.5 bathrooms abode sits on nearly 1,000 sqm.

The contemporary design is set on a hillside, with views of the Glenwild Golf Course and the Wasatch Mountains.

The multi-level space features floor-to-ceiling windows, vaulted ceilings and an open layout, with the main level boasting a huge living room with a fireplace, a formal dining room and an open kitchen with two islands.

On the next level, a master suite includes a seating area and a private terrace. Other rooms include an office, a home theatre with stadium seating, gym, den and a wet bar.

Jordan, who is an avid golf fan, has also installed a golf simulator to practice your stroke when the weather outside is too gloomy, or the nearby course is frozen over.

High-end finishes include Italian marble and bamboo flooring, granite countertops, Swiss pearwood and Macassar ebony veneer cabinets and shelves, mosaic-tiled showers and jetted bathtubs.

Outside, the house has multiple terraces, an infinity pool, fountains and an outdoor kitchen and fireplace.

And for a true fan of the home’s decor, the furniture is available for separate purchase.

Jordan, 56, is hoping has better luck offloading this home than he’s had with his Highland Park digs in Illinois.

His custom-built, 56,000-square-foot Chicago compound has been on the market since 2012. It’s still available for $15 million. If you’re unclear that he owns the place, his Bulls jersey, No. 23, is emblazoned on the front gates and it comes with a basketball court.

Jordan played 15 seasons for the NBA, mainly with the Bulls, where he won six NBA championships with the team, wowing millions around the world with his incredible scoring skill that is regarded by many to be the greatest player of all time.

He’s currently the owner of the NBA franchise the Charlotte Hornets.

description: If you truly want to “Be Like Mike,” you can buy his house. Here’s your chance to see inside NBA legend Michael Jordan’s grand mountain escape.
